title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum: Which is the Better Investment?
summary: Bitcoin is a type of “token” that is built on the “proof-of-work” network. Meanwhile, the "Eminium" network allows developers to build applications on the network. Both of these virtual currencies were created using blockchain technology. And they each have a finite supply that is expected to be released over time. Bitcoin's price has been around since 2009, and its price has risen steadily since 2011. Bitcoin’s supply is fixed, which means that the token can be exchanged for a wide range of assets.
